page.title: 19LEISURE IN FELTWELL
page.content: When we talked to people in the village we found that residents enjoyed a wide range of activities in their spare time. Some complained of lack of facilities in the area and many travelled out to places such as Thetford for entertainment. Gardening, reading, walking, riding, golf and other outdoor pursuits seemed popular,and of course television. Local pubs and clubs provide a limited night life with darts,snooker etc. In Feltwell we have several clubs, including Youth Club, Football club, cubs, brownies, Scouts and Guides, Judo, Ty-Condo, W.I., over sixties, C.A.T.S. (Theatre) and swimming. The swimming pool was given to the School by the Edmund de Moundeford Trust. Now 1l00 people from local schools and families from the area use it each week.
